headline: Bygones! Trump backs J.D. Vance, tells rally-goers ‘he’s said some not so great things about me’
author: Terresa Monroe-Hamilton
sentences:
The former president called Vance “strong on the Border,” “tough on Crime,” and willing to “hold China accountable.”
“It is time for the entire MAGA movement, the greatest in the history of our Country, to unite behind J.D.’s campaign because, unlike so many other pretenders and wannabes, he will put America First,” Trump asserted.

Now everyone needs to rally behind him and go on to a Republican victory in November
— Ryan James Girdusky (@RyanGirdusky) April 15, 2022
Vance, a former US Marine, has stated that he regrets his previous comments about Trump.
“And I ask folks not to judge me based on what I said in 2016, because I’ve been very open that I did say those critical things and I regret them, and I regret being wrong about the guy.
The Democrats will be spending many millions of dollars, but the good news is that they have a defective candidate who ran for President and garnered exactly zero percent in the polls.
Trump endorsed Dr. Mehmet Oz in Pennsylvania who has taken a number of non-conservative stances over the years involving the border, abortion, guns, and climate change.

Vance (@JDVance1) April 15, 2022
Trump acknowledged that endorsing Vance was not “easy.” He said he genuinely likes and respects other candidates in the crowded race.
He was an incredible fighter for hard working Americans in the White House, he will be again, and I'll fight for the America First Agenda in the Senate.
The bottom line is, we must have a Republican victory in Ohio,” Trump said, letting bygones be bygones in favor of securing a Republican win for Ohio.

(@realchrisrufo) April 15, 2022
The endorsement is likely to anger a number of top Republicans in the state as well as many conservative voters.
Trump chose Vance, who was a Never-Trumper in the beginning, over other candidates who have been loyal to the former president from the get-go.
Vance on Friday in a statement that openly admitted the Ohio Senate candidate has said “some not so great things about me” in the past.

I think he was a good president, I think he made a lot of good decisions for people, and I think he took a lot of flak.”
